result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont M Smith Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.   Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
$618  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AG and may not be on her property or her residence. Can be indirect contact through other party to arrange for child custody with approval of agent.
Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

When doing so intention was to join and not consolidate.  Therefore, Ct. orders consolidation of cases vacated.  Ct. orders case 15CF2475 reopened and case 15CF2475 & 15CF2344 joined. CASH BOND AMENDED - REFERRAL TO BMP
$1000 (per case)

It is hereby ordered that that Def is terminated from BMP and cash bail is reinstated in the amount of $3,000 per case with BMP removed as a condition of bond. All other bail conditions remain set.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Adrienne G., Jerika D., R.C., C.N.S., or H.E.T.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.  
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not be in the 5800 block of Russett Rd in Madison, WI.
- The court orders a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $3000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 7
